channel.title: rsca.gs.io.WorldLoader.loadSection(int, int, int, World, int, int) slows down
channel.description:
WorldLoader class, loadSection function parses the data for ~2 minutes out of the blue. I haven't changed that function (although I did re-write the start up of the server a bit).
The extremely weird part is that it boots up in 3 seconds on my windows PC but on the server (linux box) it boots for 2 minutes. Any thoughts on what could cause this?
And no, it's not a server disk problem. Tried an older version of the gameserver without the latest changes I added and it loads fine. [br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 28, 2009, 04:47:20 am[/size][hr]My PC:
[java] 2009.10.28 12:43:53 Loaded 7 quests successfully (16ms) [java] 2s to parse [java] 2009.10.28 12:43:56 12 NPC Scripts loaded!
Server:
2009.10.28 03:44:15 Loaded 7 quests successfully (20ms) 108s to parse 2009.10.28 03:46:04 12 NPC Scripts loaded!

item.title: rsca.gs.io.WorldLoader.loadSection(int, int, int, World, int, int) slows down
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

meatstick:

What’s the spec on your server? It only takes about 1 second for our server, which is Linux as well.

RSCAs server (so yes, it’s a good box). Older versions of the game-server boot up instantly but this version takes 2 minutes and I haven’t got a clue on what I changed that would cause this kind of behaviour. [br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 28, 2009, 07:01:54 am[/size][hr]Heh fixed it. No idea why that caused the slowdown though

Read full topic
